{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3548185,"name":"Alex Tsekhansky","username":"atsekhan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/0ea827/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T14:36:42.704Z","cooked":"

Since the PP2025 thread is pretty large, I though I’d put my question in a separate thread as well to give it a little more visibility (sorry for the duplicate).

Any advise would be appreciated.

We’re trying “blue” trajectories (the ones that only located on the “blue” side of the field.

A simple trajectory that goes, say, 2 meters forward (from 1,1,0 to 3,1,0 with x,y,r) works fine.

However, a trajectory that runs backwards (e.g. from 6,4,180 to 4,3,180) makes the robot always drive to the “left” (increasing Y) and towards RED side (increasing “X”), regardless of robot orientation.

We are trying to use autobuilder.

The field-centric teleop drive works fine. We use modified CTR template for the teleop.

Any suggestions would be much appreciated.

Relevant code:

FRC999/2025Competition/blob/be43685b7ca58316e9f3a0f97bd76aca9ed491a0/C2025_release/src/main/java/frc/robot/RobotContainer.java#L598
